title: Collaborative Discourse-Based Mathematical Problem-Solving Project (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematical concepts (equations, functions, statistics, etc.)
context.additional_context: Conducting blended classes using network-based collaborative tools in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Students participate in at least three collaborative problem-solving discussions using CMC tools and submit discussion records
Learners accurately apply communication skills (questioning, feedback, rebuttal) required for constructing mathematical arguments in digital collaborative environments at 80% proficiency or higher
Teachers analyze online discussion data to assess individual learners' thought processes and provide feedback

resources: BYOD-Compatible Collaborative Learning Apps (e.g., Padlet, Google Jamboard)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
